spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The pyromancer can cast the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15}):

trait.name: Empowered Fire Elementalist
entries: The pyromancer deals an additional 4 points of fire damage whenever they deal fire damage. (Included in actions)

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The pyromancer makes two attacks using Fiery Bolt. They can replace one of the attacks with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Fiery Bolt
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) fire damage.

action.name: Fiery Explosion {@recharge 4}
entries: The pyromancer creates a magical explosion of fire centered on a point they can see within 120 feet of him. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 39 ({@damage 10d6 + 4}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

reaction.name: Arcane Defense (3/Day)
entries: When they are hit by an attack, the pyromancer protects themselves with an {@condition invisible} barrier of magical force. Until the end of their next turn, they gains a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack.

reaction.name: Rebuking Flames (3/Day)
entries: When the pyromancer takes damage from a creature within 30 feet of them, they can force that creature to make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 2d10 + 4} fire damage on a failed save or half as much on a success.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The acidmancer can cast the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15, +7 to hit with spells}):

trait.name: Empowered Acid Elementalist
entries: The acidmancer deals an additional 4 points of acid damage whenever they deal acid damage. (Included in actions)

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The acidmancer makes two attacks using Mote of Acid. They can replace one of the attacks with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Mote of Acid
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 4d4 + 4}) acid damage.

action.name: Acid Rain {@recharge 4}
entries: The acidmancer creates a magical green cloud hovering over a point they choose within 120 feet. Each creature in a 30-foot-radius and 30-foot tall cylinder centered on that point must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 28 ({@damage 12d4 + 4}) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

reaction.name: Arcane Defense (3/Day)
entries: When they are hit by an attack, the acidmancer protects themselves with an {@condition invisible} barrier of magical force. Until the end of their next turn, they gains a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The aeromancer can cast the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15, +7 to hit with spell attacks}):

trait.name: Empowered Storm Elementalist
entries: The aeromancer deals an additional 4 points of lightning or thunder damage whenever they deal lightning or thunder damage. (Included in actions)

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The aeromancer makes two attacks using Storm Strike. They can replace one of the attacks with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Storm Strike
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) lightning or thunder damage.

action.name: Lightning Strike {@recharge 4}
entries: The aeromancer produces a storm cloud which calls forth a lightning bolt from the sky. They choose a creature they can see within 100 feet of them, that creature and every creature within 5ft of it must make a Dexterity saving throw {@dc 15} or take {@damage 3d10 + 4} lightning damage on a failed save or half as much on a success. The storm cloud then disperses.

bonus.name: Blast of Wind
entries: Wind builds up and rushes outward in a 30 foot long 10 foot wide line from the aeromancer. Every creature within the line must make a Strength saving throw {@dc 15} or be pushed 10 feet away from the line.

reaction.name: Arcane Defense (3/Day)
entries: When they are hit by an attack, the aeromancer protects themselves with an {@condition invisible} barrier of magical force. Until the end of their next turn, they gains a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack.

reaction.name: Storm's Fury
entries: When the aeromancer is hit by a melee attack, they can deal lightning {@damage 2d6 + 4} lightning or thunder damage to the attacker and they must make a Strength saving throw {@dc 15} or they are pushed 20 feet away from them.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The aquamancer can cast the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15}):

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The Aquamancer can breathe air and water.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The aquamancer makes two attacks using Watery Whip. They can replace one of the attacks with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Watery Whip
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Giant Wave {@recharge 4}
entries: The aquamancer creates a magical tidal wave that instantly rushes outward in a 10-foot-tall, 10-foot-wide, and 30-foot-long line. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw, taking 33 ({@damage 8d8}) bludgeoning damage and is pushed 20 feet and knocked {@condition prone} on a failed save, or half as much damage on a success and is not pushed or knocked {@condition prone}.

bonus.name: Refreshing Healing (3/Day)
entries: The aquamancer can use its bonus action to touch a creature and heal it with magical healing water. The creature regains {@dice 3d8 + 3} hit points and the aquamancer can choose one condition or disease the creature is suffering, if any, and end it.

reaction.name: Arcane Defense (3/Day)
entries: When they are hit by an attack, the pyromancer protects themselves with an {@condition invisible} barrier of magical force. Until the end of their next turn, they gains a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The geomancer can cast the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15}):

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The geomancer makes two attacks using Earthen Slam. They can replace one of the attacks with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Earthen Slam
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Gaia's Shaking Earth {@recharge 4}
entries: The geomancer magically shakes the earth beneath him, causing a quake in a 60-foot-radius. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw, taking 30 ({@damage 6d10}) bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone} on a failed save, or half as much damage on a success and is not knocked {@condition prone}.

bonus.name: Gaia's Grace (3/Day)
entries: The geomancer can use its bonus action to choose a creature they can see within 30 feet of them. The target magically regains {@dice 3d4 + 3} hit points and any poisons or diseases are ended.

reaction.name: Arcane Defense (3/Day)
entries: When they are hit by an attack, the pyromancer protects themselves with an {@condition invisible} barrier of magical force. Until the end of their next turn, they gains a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack.

spell.name: Blustering Winds
entries: You extend your hands and gales of wind blows around you in a 10 foot radius centered on you. Creatures within range make a strength saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 1d10} bludgeoning damage and is pushed 10 feet back and knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, they take half damage and suffers no additional effects.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd or higher level, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Whelm

components.m: A vile filled with water from a waterfall

entries: You conjure an overwhelming amount of water that crashes onto a creature you can see within range with crushing force. That creature must make a Strength saving throw, or fall {@condition prone} and are {@condition restrained}. A flying creature is forced to the ground, but only takes half the normal amount of fall damage they would have received. At the start of each of the target's turns it takes {@dice 1d10} points of bludgeoning damage. At the end of the creature's turns it can repeat its saving throw, ending the spell on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd or higher level, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Rock Slide
entries: You conjure a series of falling rocks at a point you can see within range in a 15-foot tall, 15-foot-long, and 5-foot-wide line. Every creature in the line makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 3d6} bludgeoning damage and fall {@condition prone} on a failed save, or half as much on a success and are not knocked {@condition prone}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd or higher level, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Water Whack
entries: Water wraps around your hand and you wave it at a creature, slamming it into them. Make a melee spell attack against a creature within range. On hit, the target takes {@damage 2d10} bludgeoning damage and makes a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, they pushed back 5 feet and are knocked {@condition prone}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd or higher level, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Cutting Wind
entries: Magical winds build up in your hands and launch out to a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack. On hit, the target takes {@damage 1d6} slashing damage and are left scarred with magic. Until the start of your next turn, the next weapon attack that hits the target deals an additional {@damage 1d6} damage of the weapon's type.

This spell's damage increases when you reach certain levels. At 5th level, the attack's damage increases by {@damage 1d6} ({@dice 2d6}). Both damage rolls increase by {@dice 1d6} at 11th level ({@dice 3d6} and {@dice 2d6}) and the attack again increases by {@dice 1d6} at 17th level ({@dice 4d6} and {@dice 2d6}).

spell.name: Water Splash
entries: Each creature in a 5-foot radius of a point you choose within range makes a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, they take {@damage 1d4} bludgeoning damage and are pushed 5 feet away from the center.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d4} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d4}), 11th level ({@dice 3d4}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d4}).

spell.name: Burning Touch
entries: You ignite your hands with red hot flames and attempt to burn a creature. Make a melee spell attack, on hit it takes {@damage 2d8} fire damage and must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, they are caught on fire and takes an additional {@damage 1d8} fire damage at the start of each of their turns for the duration. A creature can use its action to put out the flames, or at the end of each of the affected creature's turn it can repeat its Constitution save, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the initial damage dealt by the attack increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Cyclone
entries: You summon a brief powerful windstorm to launch your enemies into the air. Choose a point within range, you summon a swirling windstorm in a 20-foot tall 20-foot radius cylinder. Every creature within the cylinder makes a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, they take {@damage 6d6} bludgeoning damage and are pulled to the top of the cylinder toward the center, falling to the ground afterward. On a success they take half as much and are not pulled.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Investiture of Water
entries: Until the spell ends, your body takes a watery appearance, and you gain the following benefits:

items: You have resistance to cold; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from non-magical attacks.
You have a swim speed of 60 feet and can breathe underwater as you do air.
You are always treated as if you were submerged underwater.

You can use your action to create a 10 foot long whip made of water. You can use a bonus action to attack with the whip. When you do, make a melee spell attack with a range of 10 feet. On hit, the water whip deals {@dice 2d4} plus your spellcasting ability modifier bludgeoning damage and the target makes a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, they are knocked {@condition prone}.

You can use your action to control nearby water to snare your enemies. Choose a creature within 30 feet of a pool of water that is within 120 feet of you. That creature must make a Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition restrained}. You can use a bonus action to drag a creature {@condition restrained} in this way 10 feet closer to the pool. Once the creature is close enough, it can be dragged underneath the pool of water. A creature can use an action to repeat its Strength save, ending the {@condition restrained} effect on a success.

spell.name: Boulder Bash
entries: You conjure a giant rock and throw it in a 5-foot-wide 30-foot-long line. Each creature within range must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 3d10} bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone} on a failed save or half as much on a success and is not knocked {@condition prone}. When the rock reaches the end of its range, or if it hits a wall, the rock vanishes. If it hits a wall, the wall automatically takes damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd or higher level, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 2nd

spell.name: Suffocating Sphere
entries: You attempt to draw the air out of a creature you can see within range. A creature is unaffected by the spell if it does not need to breathe. The creature makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature immediately starts to suffocate and begins choking. It can survive for a number of rounds equal to its Constitution modifier (minimum of 1 round). After the previously mentioned rounds have passed, at the start of its next turn, it drops to 0 hit points and is dying, and it can't regain hit points or be stabilized until it can breathe again.

At the end of every round before it is reduced to 0 hit points, the creature can repeat its Constitution saving throw, ending the spell on a success. Once the creature is reduced to 0 hit points, you concentrate on the spell until the creature dies or until the duration ends.

spell.name: Weightless Form
entries: You become lighter than a feather. You and everything you are wearing and carrying become completely weightless, removing your tether from gravity. If you stop wearing or carrying an object, they regain their weight.

For the duration, you have a magical flying speed equal to your walking speed and can hover. In addition, you are immune to being {@condition prone} as you float back onto your feet at the cost of no movement and take no damage as a result from falling. Anytime you are hit by an attack, you are pushed back 10 feet away from the attacker.
If you are still flying when the spell ends, you safely descend at a rate of 60 feet per round until you touch the ground.

spell.name: Aquarius's Veil

m.text: A gilded gemstone worth 500 gp filled with ocean water

entries: You don yourself with a veil of watery armor. Until the spell ends, you have the following benefits:

items: You have immunity to fire damage and resistance to cold damage.
You have a swim speed of 80 feet and can breathe underwater as you do air.
While you're not wearing armor, your armor class becomes 14 + your Dexterity modifier and you have advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws.

You have advantage on attack rolls made with daggers, javelins, shortswords, spears, or tridents and you can use your spellcasting ability for the attack and damage rolls made with such weapons in place of Strength or Dexterity.
You gain 60 temporary hit points. If any of these remain when the spell ends, they are lost.

spell.name: Gaia's Transformation

m.text: A chunk of rare precious metal worth 1000 gp infused with magical moss, which the spell consumes

entries: You assume a magical form by mimicking the powers of Gaia. Your body becomes stone and moss forms randomly around your body. Choose either Guardian or Warrior. You gain the following benefits depending on what you chose when you cast the spell:

items: You are immune to poison; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from non-magical weapons that are not adamantine. You have resistance to slashing, piercing, and bludgeoning damage regardless of the source.
You are immune to the {@condition poisoned} and {@condition petrified} conditions.
Your size becomes one size category larger. If you were gargantuan, you become twice as large. As a result, you deal twice as much damage with weapons against objects.
You have a burrow speed of 40 feet and can move through solid stone effortlessly, leaving the earth untampered with as you pass by.
You have a +2 bonus to AC (Guardian), or you have a +2 bonus to Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws (Warrior).
All your weapon attacks are magical, and when you make a weapon attack, you can use your spellcasting ability modifier, instead of Strength or Dexterity, for the attack and damage rolls.
You gain 100 temporary hit points (Guardian) or you gain 50 temporary hit points (Warrior). If any of these remain when the spell ends, they are lost.

Your weapon attacks deal an additional {@damage 2d10} bludgeoning damage (Warrior) or when you're not wearing armor, your AC becomes 20. You can still gain the benefits of a shield while under the effects of this spell (Guardian).

(Warrior) You can attack twice, instead of once, when you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn. You ignore this benefit if you already have a feature, like Extra Attack, that lets you attack more than once when you take the Attack action on your turn; (Guardian) or you can use your action to form a protective barrier on any number of allies within 30 feet of you, protecting them from damage from one source reducing that damage to 0 (such as a weapon, spell, a dragon's breath weapon, etc.). This barrier lasts until the start of your next turn.

spell.name: Poseidon's Wrath
entries: You conjure a wave of immeasurable force in a 500-foot-high, 500-foot-long, 100-foot-thick. Every creature and object in the area makes a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, every creature takes {@damage 12d10} bludgeoning damage and {@damage 12d10} cold damage and are knocked {@condition prone} and pushed to the end of the wave. Objects take twice the amount of damage and automatically fail the save. Creatures that save take only half damage and are pushed only half the distance they normally would be pushed and are not knocked {@condition prone}.

Magical and non-magical fire in the area is immediately extinguished and creatures who took the damage from this spell gains resistance to fire damage for the next minute. Spells that set creatures on fire and persist immediately end on affected creatures.
The area affected is not flooded, as the water dissipates after the spell takes effect.

spell.name: Flames of Avernus
entries: A wave of heat bursts out of your hands originating from the nine hells, incinerating creatures in a 120-foot cone of fire. Each creature within range makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save they take {@damage 20d6} fire damage and are lit on fire for the duration. Creatures who failed take {@damage 5d6} fire damage at the start of each of their turns. As an action, a creature can attempt to put out the flames with a Dexterity ability check against your spell save DC. A creature that attempts this, pass or fail, takes {@damage 2d6} fire damage. On a success, the flames are put out and its effects no longer persist. On a fail, the flames and the spell persists.
On a successful save, the creatures take half the initial damage and are not lit on fire.
A creature who dies while under the effects of the spell has their body immediately turned to scorched ash, leaving behind only any magical items they had in their possession.

spell.name: Gale of The Primordials

components.m: a wing from a powerful creature, such as an angel or winged beast from the elemental plane of air

entries: A powerful wind builds up from your feet, granting you unmatched flight. You gain a flying speed of 150 feet for the duration. You take no damage as a result of falling and are immune to being {@condition grappled} or {@condition restrained} as wind rushes from you, preventing anything from keeping hold of you.
Ranged attacks made against you have disadvantage and automatically miss if you are within their long range distance.

spell.name: Gaia's Wrath

components.m: a small chunk of a meteorite

entries: You conjure a large object made of stone which appears 200 feet above the point you choose. The stone can take any shape or appearance, so long as it is purely made of a form of earth. The object crashes directly onto the point you choose and creates. Each creature within a 60-foot radius makes a dexterity saving throw or takes {@damage 40d6} bludgeoning damage from the debris, or half as much on a success.
Objects in the area automatically take twice as much damage.
A 60-foot radius and 30-foot deep creator is left in the wake of the object, with the object completely destroyed and gravel fills the area, making it difficult terrain

spell.name: Static Smite
entries: The first time you hit with a melee weapon attack during this spell's duration, your weapon crackles with electricity, and the attack deals an extra {@damage 1d10} lightning damage. Additionally, if the target is a creature, it must succeed a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated} until the start of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the initial extra damage dealt by the attack increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Chilling Smite
entries: The next time you hit with a melee weapon attack during this spell's duration, your weapon is freezing cold to the touch, and the attack deals an extra {@damage 1d8} cold damage. If the target is a creature, at the start of its next turn it must succeed a Constitution saving throw or have their movement speed cut in half until the spell ends. The creature may repeat its save at the start of each of its turns until the spell ends, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the initial extra damage dealt by the attack increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Thunderstomp
entries: You stomp your foot or strike your weapon against the ground, creating a ripple of power that you can use to knock down your foes. Choose a creature within range, that creature must make a Strength saving throw or fall {@condition prone} and take {@damage 4d6} thunder damage, or half as much on a success and are not knocked {@condition prone}. You and the creature must be on the same solid surface, otherwise the spell fails.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Lightning Whip
entries: You evoke an electrifying whip in your free hand. It is similar in size and shape to an actual whip, and it lasts for the duration. It has the light and reach properties. If you let go of the whip, it disappears, but you can evoke the whip again as a bonus action.

You can use your action to make a melee spell attack with the lightning whip. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 3d4} lightning damage and it must succeed on a Strength saving throw. On a fail, the target is knocked {@condition prone}.
In addition, you can use your bonus action to make a melee spell attack with the lightning whip, however it instead deals {@damage 1d4} lightning damage on hit instead of {@dice 3d4}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d4} for every two slot levels above 2nd.

spell.name: Slipstream

components.m: a few drops of oil and water

entries: You create a low-cresting wave of water that carries the target along the surface of water or the ground. The target's walking speed is increased by 20 feet until the spell ends. In addition, swimming does not cost the target any additional movement. If the target had a swim speed, it is increased by 30 feet until the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Static Discharge
entries: Electric energy builds up within you and you release it outward in a powerful burst of energy. Each creature (except yourself) within range makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 3d8} lightning damage  and is {@condition stunned} until the end of your next turn on a failed save, or half as much on a success and is not {@condition stunned}.

Rather than using it's normal casting time, you can instead spend your entire turn building up energy and cast it immediately at the start of your next turn, taking up your action for your next turn. When you do so, creatures have disadvantage on the saving throw and you add two additional damage dice. In addition, the radius is increased by an additional 5 feet. See 'Longer Casting Times' on page 202 of the Player's Handbook for reference on casting a spell for longer than 1 action.
Charging the spell leaves you fatigued for a time. You gain one level of {@condition exhaustion} for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Ballad of Storms

components.m: a musical instrument worth at least 100 gp

entries: Your voice and song empowers a single creature that can hear you within range. The song is an intermingling of the elemental planes of air and water, syncing together in a perfect harmony. Until the spell ends, the target has a flying speed of 60 feet and can hover.

In addition, the target can empower their weapons and magic with the primordial energies of the elemental plane of air and the elemental plane of water. Whenever the target deals damage with a weapon or spell, they can deal an additional {@damage 2d8} lightning or thunder damage and creatures who take this damage are pushed up to 10 feet away from the attacker or source of the spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Ballad of Fiery Earth

components.m: a musical instrument worth at least 100 gp

entries: Your voice and song empowers a single creature that can hear you within range. The song is an intermingling of the elemental planes of earth and fire, syncing together in a perfect harmony. Until the spell ends, the target is wreathed in magical flames that retaliate against creatures that hit them with melee attacks, dealing {@damage 1d8} fire damage to the attacker.

In addition, the target can empower their weapons and magic with the primordial energies of the elemental plane of earth and the elemental plane of fire. Whenever the target deals damage with a weapon or spell, they can deal an additional {@damage 2d8} fire or poison damage.
Also, whenever a creature under the effects of this spell heals a creature with a spell, they can add {@dice 1d8} healing to one of the rolls.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Ballad of Flowing Life

components.m: a musical instrument worth at least 100 gp

entries: Your voice and song empowers a single creature that can hear you within range. The song is an intermingling of the elemental planes of earth and water, syncing together in a perfect harmony. Until the spell ends, the target has a swim and climb speed of 60 feet and do not suffer penalties to their speed while traversing through difficult terrain.

In addition, the target can empower their ability to heal immensely by channeling both of the primordial energies of the elemental plane of earth and the elemental plane of water. Whenever they heal a creature with a spell, they can add an additional {@dice 2d8} healing to one of the rolls from the spell.
In addition, when they heal a creature with a spell, they can remove any one condition or disease, or they can remove one level of {@condition exhaustion}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 6th.

subclass.name: Way of the Four Elements Redux
subclassFeatures: Way of the Four Elements|Monk||Four Elements RE|ErikkusElementalExpansionCompendium|3
Disciple of the Elements|Monk||Four Elements RE|ErikkusElementalExpansionCompendium|3
Master of The Elements|Monk||Four Elements RE|ErikkusElementalExpansionCompendium|17

subclassFeature.name: Way of the Four Elements
entries: You follow a monastic tradition that teaches you to harness the elements. When you focus your ki, you can align yourself with the forces of creation and bend the four elements to your will, using them as an extension of your body. Some members of this tradition dedicate themselves to a single element, but others weave the elements together.
Many monks of this tradition tattoo their bodies with representations of their ki powers, commonly imagined as coiling dragons, but also as phoenixes, fish, plants, mountains, and cresting waves.

subclassFeature.name: Disciple of the Elements
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you learn magical disciplines that harness the power of the four elements. A discipline requires you to spend ki points each time you use it.
You know the Elemental Attunement discipline and two other elemental disciplines of your choice. You learn one additional elemental discipline of your choice at 6th, 11th, and 17th level.
Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can also replace one elemental discipline that you already know with a different discipline.

entries.name: Casting Elemental Spells
entries: Some elemental disciplines allow you to cast spells. See {@book chapter 10|PHB|10} of the Player's Handbook for the general rules of spellcasting. To cast one of these spells, you use its casting time and other rules, but you don't need to provide material components for it.

Once you reach 5th level in this class, you can spend additional ki points to increase the level of an elemental discipline spell that you cast, provided that the spell has an enhanced effect at a higher level, as {@spell burning hands} does. The spell's level increases by 1 for each additional ki point you spend. For example, if you are a 5th-level monk and use Sweeping Cinder Strike to cast {@spell burning hands}, you can spend 3 ki points to cast it as a 2nd-level spell (the discipline's base cost of 2 ki points plus 1).

The maximum number of ki points you can spend to cast a spell in this way (including its base ki point cost and any additional ki points you spend to increase its level) is determined by your monk level, as shown in the Spells and Ki Points table. At 5th level, you may spend up to 3 ki points; this increases to 4 ki points at 9th level, 5 at 13th level, and 6 at 17th level.

entries.caption: Spells and Ki Points
colLabels: Maximum Ki Points for a Spell

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Form
entries: Also at 3rd level when you take the attack action, you can choose to enter an elemental form, which lasts for 1 minute, by spending a ki point. When you enter an elemental form, choose either Air, Earth, Fire, or Water. You gain one of the following benefits while your Elemental Form is active:

entries.name: Air
entries: Light like a feather, a leaf on the wind. Your reach for your melee attacks using unarmed strikes or monk weapons is increased by 5 feet and you can use your Wisdom score in place of your Strength when determining how far or how high you can jump.

entries.name: Earth
entries: Stubborn like stone and unmoving like boulders. You have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from non-magical attacks and have advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to resist being pushed back or knocked {@condition prone}.

entries.name: Fire
entries: Power erupts from your body and is focused onto your fists and weapons. Your unarmed strikes and monk weapons deal fire damage instead of its normal damage type. In addition, you have resistance to fire damage.

entries.name: Water
entries: You are unfettered by the oceanic tides. While your feet are submerged in water, your movement speed is increased by 10 feet and swimming does not cost you any additional movement. In addition you have resistance to cold damage.

In addition to these benefits, while your chosen Elemental Form is active, disciplines that associate with said element costs 1 less ki for the initial cost of the discipline, to a minimum cost of 1 ki point. For example, while your Elemental Form is active and you are using your Fire Form and you use Sweeping Cinder Strike to cast {@spell burning hands}, you can spend 1 ki point instead of its base cost of 2.
You can only have the benefits of one chosen element at any given time, however you can change the benefits of your Elemental Form when you take the attack action by spending an additional ki point.

Your elemental form requires concentration which acts as if you were concentrating on a spell. If an elemental discipline casts a spell that requires concentration, you maintain concentration on both that spell and your elemental form. Losing concentration on either one breaks concentration on the other.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Disciplines
entries: The elemental disciplines are presented in alphabetical order. If a discipline requires a level, you must be the level in this class to learn the discipline.

entries.name: Breathtaking Dance (20th Level Required)
entries: You can spend 6 ki points to cast {@spell suffocating sphere|ErikkusElementalExpansionCompendium}.

entries.name: Clench of the North Wind (6th Level Required)
Dance of Fiery Dragons (20th level required)
entries: You can spend 6 ki points to cast {@spell fire storm}.

entries.name: Flames of the Phoenix (11th Level Required)
Gong of the Summit (6th Level Required)
Direct the Thunderstorm (11th Level Required)
entries: You can spend 4 ki points to cast {@spell lightning bolt}.

entries.name: Ride the Waves (6th Level Required)
entries: You can spend 3 ki to cast {@spell slipstream|ErikkusElementalExpansionCompendium}.

entries.name: River of Hungry Flame (17th Level Required)
Rolling Stone (6th Level Required)
entries: You can spend 3 ki to cast {@spell boulder bash|ErikkusElementalExpansionCompendium}.

entries.name: Slapping Waves
entries: You can spend 2 ki to cast {@spell water whack|ErikkusElementalExpansionCompendium}.

entries.name: Step of Giants
entries: You can spend 2 ki to cast {@spell thunderstomp|ErikkusElementalExpansionCompendium}.

entries.name: Waterfall of the Elders (6th Level Required)
entries: You can spend 3 ki to cast {@spell whelm|ErikkusElementalExpansionCompendium}.

entries.name: Wave of Rolling Earth (17th Level Required)
Whirlwind Ballet (11th Level Required)
entries: You can spend 4 ki to cast {@spell cyclone|ErikkusElementalExpansionCompendium}.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Elemental Discipline
entries: You learn one additional elemental discipline of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Focus
entries: At 6th level, you’ve put focus and practice into one particular element. When you finish a long rest, choose either Air, Earth, Fire, or Water. Depending on your choice, you gain one of the following benefits which ends the next time you finish a long rest and you can choose a different benefit or regain the one that ended:

entries.name: Air
entries: Your body becomes unfettered by the ground beneath your feet. You gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed and can hover, however if you end your turn airborne you slowly descend 60 feet and either safely touch the ground or end your turn falling.

entries.name: Earth
entries: Attuned to the earth beneath you, you’ve hardened your body to be sturdier. Your current and maximum hit points are increased by an amount equal to your Monk level.

entries.name: Fire
entries: Flames burn from within your soul and allow you to turn your foes to ash. Once per turn, when you hit with an unarmed strike or monk weapon you can add an additional amount of fire damage equal to your martial arts die.

entries.name: Water
entries: Fluid like the river, your movements through water are effortless and your body adapts to underwater environments. You have a swimming speed equal to your walking speed and can breathe underwater as you do air. In addition, as a bonus action you can use extreme focus to stand perfectly still on water not falling through it as you normally would. This extreme focus ends when you take damage or when you move.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Elemental Discipline
entries: You learn one additional elemental discipline of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Elementalist
entries: At 11th level, you’ve heightened your control over the elements granting you unique abilities depending on your Elemental Focus. While your Elemental Focus is active, you can cast one of the following spells without requiring material components or spending a spell slot or kit points depending on which element you chose:

subclassFeature.name: Extra Elemental Discipline
entries: You learn one additional elemental discipline of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Master of The Elements
entries: At 17th level you’ve attained absolute mastery over your elemental techniques. Choose one of your Elemental Disciplines. You can use that discipline as if you spent the minimum required ki point cost without expending any ki.
In addition, while your Elemental Focus is active you gain one of the following benefits depending on the element you chose:

entries.name: Air
entries: When you take the attack action using a monk weapon or unarmed strike, you can use the shove action as part of the attack action. In addition, you no longer descend at the end of your turn while flying.

entries.name: Earth
entries: Once per turn, when you take damage from an attack you can reduce that damage by an amount equal to your martial arts die.

entries.name: Fire
entries: Whenever you deal fire damage, you add a bonus to one of the damage rolls equal to your Wisdom modifier.

entries.name: Water
entries: While your feet are submerged in water your speed is doubled. In addition, you have advantage on attack rolls against a creature who does not have a swim speed while initiated in underwater combat.

In addition, you can use your action and spend 6 ki points to cast {@spell Investiture of Flame|XGE}, {@spell Investiture of Ice|XGE}, {@spell Investiture of Stone|XGE}, {@spell Investiture of Water|ErikkusElementalExpansionCompendium}, or {@spell Investiture of Wind|XGE}. Once you’ve cast one of these spells, you cannot cast any of these spells again until you have completed a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Primordial Soul
entries: Born with powers of primordial elders, you’ve mastered magic that revolves around the elements. The earth beneath your feet erecting from the ground in pillars of stone, the scorching hot flames wreathing off your body burning your foes, coiling water veiling you with a protective barrier, or commanding the wind around you to keep enemies at bay.

subclassFeature.name: Primordial Magic
entries: Your knowledge of the elemental planes expands your magical capabilities. You learn spells at certain levels based on an associated element, as detailed on the table below. Once you gain access to one of these spells, it counts as a sorcerer spell for you and does not count towards your number of spells known.
Each of these spells can be swapped for a different elemental spell of the same type and same level by approval of your DM.

subclassFeature.name: Primordial Form
entries: Also at 1st level, when you cast a spell from your Primordial Magic feature, you can instantly transform into an embodiment of the element you chose. You appear as an Elemental from that particular plane, for example if you chose Fire then your body would wreathe in flames and your eyes would glow like burning coals.

While in this primordial form, you gain a bonus to damage rolls related to your chosen element equal to your charisma modifier. Elements such as air, earth, or water are vague about what constitutes associated elements. Best rule of thumb, your DM has the final say, however air could include spells that use thunder or lightning, but not all spells. Whereas earth, water, and air can all be associated with bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing depending on the spell. Regardless, all the spells listed for your chosen element in your Primordial Magic feature will associate with your chosen element.
In addition, when you enter your primordial form you gain a number of temporary hit points equal to your sorcerer level plus your charisma modifier.
You remain in this primordial form for 1 minute and once you enter this form you cannot do so again until you finish a short or long rest.
Also, you know how to speak, read, and write Primordial.

subclassFeature.name: Primordial Resistance
entries: Starting at 6th level, you gain resistance to poison damage and have advantage on saving throws against being poisoned.
In addition, you gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage while your Primordial Form is active.
Also, you always have resistance to a certain damage type based on the element you chose regardless if your primordial form is active or not:

entries.name: Air
entries: You gain resistance to thunder damage.

entries.name: Earth
entries: You gain resistance to acid damage.

entries.name: Fire
entries: You gain resistance to fire damage.

entries.name: Water
entries: You gain resistance to cold damage.

subclassFeature.name: Primordial Essence
entries: Also at 6th level, when you use a metamagic option on a spell from your Primordial Magic feature, you can regain 1d6 hit points per sorcery point spent on the metamagic option for the spell. You can only gain this magical healing once a round.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Evolution
entries: Starting at 14th level, you can enter your Primordial Form as an action by spending 5 sorcery points. Your Primordial Form now lasts for an hour rather than a minute. While in your Primordial Form you gain certain benefits depending on the element you chose:

entries.name: Air
entries: You have a magical flying speed of 60 feet and you can hover. In addition, you can pass through spaces as narrow as 1 inch, so long as air can pass through it.

entries.name: Earth
entries: At the start of each of your turns, so long as your feet are touching the ground, you can gain temporary hit points equal to your Charisma modifier. In addition, you have tremorsense out to a range of 60 feet.

entries.name: Fire
entries: Flames erupt from your body whenever you’re in danger, scolding anyone who dares strike you. When a creature within 60 feet of you deals damage to you from an attack, they take 1d10 fire damage.

entries.name: Water
entries: You have a magical swim speed of 60 feet, can breathe underwater as you do air, and while fully submerged in water you can use a bonus action to teleport up to 60 feet to another space that is also underwater.

subclassFeature.name: Elder Elemental
entries: At 18th level, your very being permanently changes as you ascend to the peak of your elemental ancestry. You are always under the effects of your Primordial Form and can shift your appearance to appear as your natural self or your primordial self.
The temporary hit points you’d originally receive when you would enter your primordial form instead are gained after you finish a short or long rest.
In addition, the spell you gained at 1st level from your Primordial Magic feature can be cast at its lowest level without expending a spell slot or requiring material components.

subclassFeature.name: College Of The Elemental Dancer
entries: A true master of elements shifts between them, effortlessly and elegantly. As fluid with their movements as a flowing river, as hard to hit as a feather riding the wind, hits as hard as a flying rock, and as hot as flames when need be.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Dance
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you can expend a use of your bardic inspiration to begin an elemental dance which lasts for 1 minute. During this time, choose a tempo from air, earth, fire, or water.  You gain one of the following benefits depending on what you chose, and you can shift your chosen element as a bonus action on subsequent turns:

entries.caption: Elemental Dance Table
rows: Your movement speed is increased by 10 feet and you can hover up to a foot off the ground effortlessly. You can cast the {@spell cutting wind|ErikkusElementalExpansionCompendium} cantrip, which counts as a bard spell for you.

Your body becomes tough as stone, you have resistance to non-magical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage and you can cast the {@spell magic stone|XGE} cantrip, which counts as a bard spell for you.
You can cast the {@spell fire bolt} cantrip, which counts as a bard spell for you, and your weapon attacks deal an extra amount of fire damage equal to your bardic inspiration die.

You can walk across the surface of water as you would solid ground, however you still fall through the water if you end your turn there. You can cast the {@spell water splash|ErikkusElementalExpansionCompendium} cantrip, which counts as a bard spell for you.

subclassFeature.name: Primordial Tongue
entries: Also at 3rd level, your extensive knowledge on the elemental planes makes you an expert in conversing with said elementals. You know how to speak, read, and write Primordial. If you already have Primordial, you can instead choose a different language. In addition, you have advantage on Charisma ability checks made with elementals, provided you are not hostile toward them.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Inspiration
entries: Starting at 6th level, you can grant your elemental magic onto an ally while embracing it through your dance. While under the effects of your Elemental Dance, a creature with your bardic inspiration can use it to add to the damage rolls of their attacks or spells. The bonus damage is dependent on your current chosen tempo:

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Dance Improvement
entries: Also at 6th level, you gain some additional effects while in your Elemental Dance. While under the effects of your Elemental Dance, you gain a bonus to your AC equal to your Charisma modifier provided you aren't wearing medium or heavy armor or using a shield. In addition, you gain the ability to cast certain spells while using your bard spell slots while under the effects of your Elemental Dance depending on your chosen tempo, which count as bard spells for you:

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Ballet
entries: Starting at 14th level, your mastery over your primordial dancing has ascended to its peak. The first time you use your Elemental Dance feature, you do not have to spend a bardic inspiration. Every other time after the first until you finish a long rest, you spend the bardic inspiration as normal.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Conductor
entries: Also at 14th level, you’ve learned to pinpoint weakness in even the most resistant foes. When you deal damage to a creature with a resistance to acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, or thunder damage, you can choose to ignore their resistance until the end of the current turn.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier, regaining all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Breathtaking Dance
entries: You can spend 6 ki points to cast {@spell suffocating sphere|ErikkusElementalExpansionCompendium}.

optionalfeature.name: Whirlwind Ballet
entries: You can spend 4 ki to cast {@spell cyclone|ErikkusElementalExpansionCompendium}.

optionalfeature.name: Waterfall of the Elders
entries: You can spend 3 ki to cast {@spell whelm|ErikkusElementalExpansionCompendium}.

optionalfeature.name: Step of Giants
entries: You can spend 2 ki to cast {@spell thunderstomp|ErikkusElementalExpansionCompendium}.

optionalfeature.name: Slapping Waves
entries: You can spend 2 ki to cast {@spell water whack|ErikkusElementalExpansionCompendium}.

optionalfeature.name: Rolling Stone
entries: You can spend 3 ki to cast {@spell boulder bash|ErikkusElementalExpansionCompendium}.

optionalfeature.name: Ride the Waves
entries: You can spend 3 ki to cast {@spell slipstream|ErikkusElementalExpansionCompendium}.

optionalfeature.name: Direct the Thunderstorm
entries: You can spend 4 ki points to cast {@spell lightning bolt}.

optionalfeature.name: Dance of Fiery Dragons
entries: You can spend 6 ki points to cast {@spell fire storm}.

feat.name: Elemental Initiate
entries: You’ve been exposed to and have trained with the power of the elements and can use your ki to channel said elements. See “Casting Elemental Spells” from the Way of Four Elements Monk subclass for more information.

You have two ki points, of which you can only use to fuel your elemental disciplines. You regain these ki points when you finish a long rest as opposed to a short rest. Choose two elemental disciplines from the Way of Four Elements Monk subclass. When you level up you can exchange one of the disciplines chosen by this feat for another one. If a discipline has a level requirement, you must be a Way of Four Elements Monk of that level in order to choose it.

feat.name: Empowered Elementalist
entries: When you gain this feat, choose one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder.
When you cast a spell that deals damage of the chosen type, one of the damage rolls gains a bonus equal to your proficiency bonus. You can apply this bonus only once a turn.
You can select this feat multiple times. Each time you do so, you must choose a different damage type.

feat.name: Primordial Touched
entries: Your exposure to elemental energies has permanently changed you, allowing you to draw power from it. You gain the following benefits:

items: You learn the {@spell absorb elements|XGE} spell and one 1st-level spell of your choice. The {@filter 1st-level spell|spells|level=1|school=C;V} must be from the conjuration or evocation school of magic. You can cast each of these spells without expending a spell slot. When you cast absorb elements in this way, you can cast it as a 2nd level spell. Once you cast either of these spells in this way, you can't cast that spell in this way again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. The spells' spellcasting ability is the ability increased by this feat.

item.name: Robe of Acidic Defense
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to AC and saving throws while you wear these robes. You have resistance to acid damage.
In addition, while not wearing armor you are always under the effects of the {@spell mage armor} spell.

item.name: Robe of Icy Defense
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to AC and saving throws while you wear these robes. You have resistance to cold damage.
In addition, while not wearing armor you are always under the effects of the {@spell mage armor} spell.

item.name: Robe of Fiery Defense
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to AC and saving throws while you wear these robes. You have resistance to fire damage.
In addition, while not wearing armor you are always under the effects of the {@spell mage armor} spell.

item.name: Robe of Shocking Defense
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to AC and saving throws while you wear these robes. You have resistance to lightning damage.
In addition, while not wearing armor you are always under the effects of the {@spell mage armor} spell.

item.name: Robe of Toxic Defense
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to AC and saving throws while you wear these robes. You have resistance to poison damage.
In addition, while not wearing armor you are always under the effects of the {@spell mage armor} spell.

item.name: Robe of Thunderous Defense
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to AC and saving throws while you wear these robes. You have resistance to thunder damage
In addition, while not wearing armor you are always under the effects of the {@spell mage armor} spell.

item.name: Primordial Brand Tattoo
entries: Produced by a special needle, this magic tattoo is brightly colored, usually coming in hues of red, blue, green, or yellow.

entries.name: Tattoo Attunement
entries: To attune to this item, you hold the needle to your skin where you want the tattoo to appear, pressing the needle there throughout the attunement process. When the attunement is complete, the needle turns into the ink that becomes the tattoo, which appears on the skin.
If your attunement to the tattoo ends, the tattoo vanishes, and the needle reappears in your space.

entries.name: Elemental Essence
entries: You have resistance to one of the following damage types chosen by your DM: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder. In addition, melee or ranged attacks made with weapons or unarmed strikes deal an additional 1d6 damage of the chosen type.

entries.name: Elemental Burst
entries: As an action, you can call upon the power of this tattoo, causing it to glow with immense power. Make a special ranged spell attack with a +7 to hit with a range of 60 feet and no long range. The target takes 4d6 points of damage. The type of damage is determined by the type chosen for Elemental Essence. Hit or miss, the elemental magic explodes, causing the target and each creature within 5 feet of the target to make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, they take 2d6 of the aforementioned damage, or half as much on a success. Once you’ve used this ability, the tattoo’s glow dims and you cannot use it again until the next dawn.

item.name: Cloak of Energy Absorbption
entries: Woven by a special silk and harnessing primordial energies, this cloak protects the user from elemental magic.

As a reaction while wearing the cloak whenever you would take acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage, you can reduce that damage to 0 and gain temporary hit points equal to half the damage you would have taken. In addition, you have resistance to that damage type for 1 hour. If you were to take more than one of the listed damage types from the same source, you choose one of the damage types to absorb, not all of them.
Once you’ve used the property of this cloak, you cannot use it again until the next dawn.

item.name: Wraps of The Stormbringer
entries: These magical wrappings have electricity coursing within them, waiting to be released. You have a +1 to attack and damage rolls made with unarmed strikes and your unarmed strikes are treated as magical for the purposes of overcoming non-magical resistances. The wraps have 10 charges.

When you hit with a weapon attack or unarmed strike while wearing these magical wraps, you can expend 1 or more of these charges to deal an additional 1d6 points of lightning damage, to a maximum of 4 charges spent.

In addition, you can expend 1 or more of these charges to cast one of the following spells from the wrappings without expending a spell slot or requiring material components (Spell Save DC 17, +9 to hit): {@spell lightning bolt} (3 charges), {@spell storm sphere|XGE} (4 charges), {@spell chain lightning} (6 charges).
The wraps regain {@dice 1d6 + 4} expended charges daily at dawn.

item.name: Bracelet of Fire
entries: This gold bracelet is imbued with the flames of an elder phoenix, granting its wearer powerful fire magic. You have a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls while wearing this bracelet. The bracelet has 10 charges.

While wearing this bracelet, you can expend one or more of its charges (to a maximum of 3) as a reaction when a creature hits you with an attack while within 30 feet of you. That creature is then immediately ignited with powerful flames. They take 1d10 points of fire damage per charge spent.

You can expend one or more of its charges to cast the following spells through it, without spending a spell slot or requiring material components (spell save DC 17, +9 to hit): {@spell burning touch|ErikkusElementalExpansionCompendium} (1 charge), {@spell scorching ray} (2 charges), {@spell Melf's minute meteors|XGE} (3 charges), {@spell fire shield} (4 charges), or {@spell immolation|XGE} (5 charges).
The bracelet regain {@dice 1d6 + 4} expended charges daily at dawn.

item.name: Storm Branded Scimitar
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. In addition, on hit the weapon deals an additional 1d6 lightning damage and the creature cannot take reactions until the start of your next turn.

item.name: Hammer of Thunderous Might
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. In addition, on hit the weapon deals an additional 1d6 thunder damage and the creature is pushed back 5 feet.

item.name: Amulet of The Bottomless Seas
entries: This amulet with an ocean blue jade embedded within it holds a magical power that grants its wearer unique control over the seas and its creatures. When you hear the heartbeat of the ocean, you know the ruins the amulet was placed in is near, worn by the deceased King of the Seas. It is said that whoever wears this amulet becomes the true ruler of the seas.

entries.name: Attunement
entries: The artifact allows you to attune to it immediately, without having to take a short rest.

entries.name: Protetion of The Seas
entries: You have resistance to cold damage and damage dealt by creatures with a swimming speed, regardless of origin. While submerged underwater, the seas protect you from any incoming damage, granting you resistance to all damage except force or psychic.

entries.name: Sea Legs
entries: You are granted a magical swimming speed equal to twice your base movement speed and can breathe underwater as you do air. In addition, you have advantage on ability checks and saving throws made against being knocked prone.

entries.name: Master of The Seas
entries: You can speak with any beast, monstrosity, or elemental that has an innate swimming speed, even if it does not share a language with you. In addition, you have advantage on Charisma ability checks against creatures with an innate swimming speed. You can also cast {@spell command} and {@spell dominate monster} (DC 19) on said creatures at will and they have disadvantage on their saving throw against the spell.

entries.name: Tidal Magic
entries: You are granted a unique control over the seas, allowing you to cast the following spells without requiring material components or expending a spell slot (Spell Save DC 19): {@spell control water} (at will), {@spell water splash|ErikkusElementalExpansionCompendium} (at will), {@spell create or destroy water} (at will), {@spell water whack|ErikkusElementalExpansionCompendium} (at will), {@spell whelm|ErikkusElementalExpansionCompendium} (3/day), {@spell tidal wave|XGE} (3/day), {@spell water breathing} (3/day), {@spell water walk} (3/day), {@spell water wall|XGE} (3/day), {@spell investiture of water|ErikkusElementalExpansionCompendium} (1/day), {@spell tsunami} (1/day)

entries.name: Elemental Servants
entries: As an action, you can summon up to five {@creature water elemental|MM|water elementals} or one {@creature leviathan|MTF} under your control. They obey your commands and regard you as a friend. Once you’ve used this property, you cannot use it again until the next dawn. The elementals are destroyed when they reach 0 hit points, or when you use this feature again.

item.name: Crown of Eternal Flames
entries: This iron crown burns an everlasting fire when worn that grants its wearer a strong authority over fire and  creatures from the elemental plane of fire. Wearing this crown makes your eyes glow like burning coals and cinders emit from your body.

entries.name: Attunement
entries: The artifact allows you to attune to it immediately, without having to take a short rest.

entries.name: Flame Walker
entries: You have immunity to fire damage. You ignore difficult terrain created by fire, lava, molten rock, or the like and you can walk on lava as if you were walking on solid land. Your speed is doubled when traversing through such terrain. While standing in fire, or an area that would deal fire damage to creatures, you have resistance to all damage except force and psychic.

entries.name: Fiery Form
entries: You can use a bonus action to assume a fiery form or revert to your normal form. While your fiery form is active, you can move through spaces as narrow as 1 inch. You can occupy the space occupied by another creature. If you end your turn in their space, they take 2d6 fire damage. If you are hit by a melee attack and take damage while your fiery form is active, the attacker takes fire damage equal to your level. While your fiery form is active, your attacks and spells deal additional fire damage equal to your level. While your fiery form is active, you shed bright light out to a range of 30 feet and dim light for an additional 30 feet. You can freely change the range of both the bright and dim light to be as short as 5 feet for both, or as far as 60 ft for both.

entries.name: Master of The Flames
entries: You can speak with any elemental creature that either has resistance or immunity to fire damage, regardless if you share a language or not. In addition, you have advantage on Charisma ability checks against elementals with a resistance or immunity to fire. You can also cast {@spell command} and {@spell dominate monster} (DC 19) on said creatures at will and they have disadvantage on their saving throw against the spell.

entries.name: Flamebringer
entries: You are granted a unique control over fire, allowing you to cast the following spells without requiring material components or expending a spell slot (Spell Save DC 19, +11 to hit) : {@spell control flames|XGE} (at will), {@spell produce flame} (at will), {@spell burning touch|ErikkusElementalExpansionCompendium} (at will), {@spell continual flame|XGE} (at will)  {@spell flaming sphere} (at will), {@spell fireball} 3/day), {@spell wall of fire} (3/day), {@spell immolation|XGE} (3/day), {@spell investiture of flame|XGE} (1/day), {@spell fire storm} (1/day)

entries.name: Elemental Servants
entries: As an action, you can summon up to five {@creature fire elemental|MM|fire elementals} or one {@creature phoenix|MTF} under your control. They obey your commands and regard you as a friend. Once you’ve used this property, you cannot use it again until the next dawn. The elementals are destroyed when they reach 0 hit points, or when you use this feature again.

item.name: Cloak of The Boundless Skies
entries: This feathered cloak constantly billows gently, regardless if there is any wind or not. Wearing this cloak gives you authority over the skies and the creatures among it.

entries.name: Attunement
entries: The artifact allows you to attune to it immediately, without having to take a short rest.

entries.name: Sky Dancer
entries: You have resistance to damage dealt by creatures with a flying speed and you have a magical flying speed of 150 feet.

entries.name: Weather Lord
entries: You can cast control weather at will and the casting time of it for you is a bonus action. When you cast the spell from this cloak, you do not concentrate on it, the spell simply takes effect and remains in effect for it’s full duration. If you die while the spell is active, the spell ends.

entries.name: Master of The Skies
entries: You can speak with any beast, monstrosity, or elemental that has an innate flying  speed, even if it does not share a language with you. In addition, you have advantage on Charisma ability checks against creatures with an innate flying speed. You can also cast {@spell command} and {@spell dominate monster} (DC 19) on said creatures at will and they have disadvantage on their saving throw against the spell.

entries.name: Sky Magic
entries: You are granted a unique control over air, allowing you to cast the following spells without requiring material components or expending a spell slot (Spell Save DC 19, +11 to hit) : {@spell blustering winds|ErikkusElementalExpansionCompendium} (at will), {@spell gust of wind} (at will), {@spell warding wind|XGE} (at will), {@spell wind wall} (at will) {@spell control winds|XGE} (at will), {@spell cyclone|ErikkusElementalExpansionCompendium} (3/day), {@spell fly} 3/day), {@spell investiture of wind|XGE} (1/day), {@spell wind walk} (3/day), {@spell whirlwind|XGE} (1/day), {@spell suffocating sphere|ErikkusElementalExpansionCompendium} (1/day)

entries.name: Elemental Servants
entries: As an action, you can summon up to five {@creature air elemental|MM|air elementals} or one {@creature elder tempest|MTF} under your control. They obey your commands and regard you as a friend. Once you’ve used this property, you cannot use it again until the next dawn. The elementals are destroyed when they reach 0 hit points, or when you use this feature again.

item.name: Belt of The Ancient Lands
entries: This impossibly heavy belt can make the entire world quake in fear. Ancient primordials fear the champions of the past that sought and claimed this legendary belt.

entries.name: Attunement
entries: The artifact allows you to attune to it immediately, without having to take a short rest.

entries.name: Gaia's Champion
entries: You have a climb and burrow speed of 80 feet and you can burrow through solid stone at half your burrow speed. You ignore difficult terrain created by earth, stone, debris, and you can walk on quicksand as if it were ordinary ground. You have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from non-magical attacks and to damage from elementals originating from the elemental plane of earth.

entries.name: Earth Shaper
entries: As an action you can cast {@spell stone shape} at will without expending a spell slot or requiring material components.

entries.name: Master of The Lands
entries: You can speak with any beast, monstrosity, or elemental that has an innate climb or burrow speed, even if it does not share a language with you. In addition, you have advantage on Charisma ability checks against creatures with an innate climb or burrow speed. You can also cast {@spell command} and {@spell dominate monster} (DC 19) on said creatures at will and they have disadvantage on their saving throw against the spell.

entries.name: Earth Magic
entries: You are granted a unique control over air, allowing you to cast the following spells without requiring material components or expending a spell slot (Spell Save DC 19, +11 to hit) : {@spell rock slide|ErikkusElementalExpansionCompendium} (at will), {@spell earth tremor|XGE} (at will), {@spell boulder bash|ErikkusElementalExpansionCompendium} (at will), {@spell earthbind|XGE} (at will) {@spell maximilian's earthen grasp|XGE} (at will), {@spell erupting earth|XGE} (3/day), {@spell wall of stone} 3/day), {@spell investiture of stone|XGE} (1/day), {@spell bones of the earth|XGE} (3/day), {@spell move earth} (1/day), {@spell earthquake} (1/day), {@spell gaia's wrath|ErikkusElementalExpansionCompendium} (1/day)

entries.name: Elemental Servants
entries: As an action, you can summon up to five {@creature earth elemental|MM|earth elementals} or one {@creature zaratan|MTF} under your control. They obey your commands and regard you as a friend. Once you’ve used this property, you cannot use it again until the next dawn. The elementals are destroyed when they reach 0 hit points, or when you use this feature again.

item.name: Sceptor of Chaos
entries: In between the elemental planes, there are the border elements and then there is the elemental chaos. Among the chaos, this single staff floats in a random place. This scepter is a conduit for combining the other four artifacts for the elemental planes. It binds them together, much like how the other elemental planes are connected through the elemental chaos.

The staff has a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls. You have a +1 bonus to your spell attack and spell save DC. For every two artifacts listed in Part of a Whole and Destroying the Set, other than the scepter, that you are also attuned with, both of the bonuses increase by 1.

entries.name: Attunement
entries: The artifact allows you to attune to it immediately, without having to take a short rest. The first time you attune to this item a piece of your humanity is lost. You gain two indefinite madnesses, which cannot be cured by any means. Neither magic nor divine intervention can reverse these effects.

entries.name: Chaos Magic
entries: The staff has 10 charges. For every artifact listed in Part of a Whole and Destroying the Set, other than the scepter, that you are also attuned with, the staff gains another 10 charges. By expending one or more of the staff’s charges, you can cast the following spells as an action without expending a spell slot or requiring material components using your spell save and spell attack bonuses: {@spell absorb elements|XGE} (1 charge), {@spell chaos bolt|XGE} (1 charge) {@spell magic missile} (1 charge), {@spell magnify gravity|EGW} (1 charge), {@spell cyclone|ErikkusElementalExpansionCompendium} (3 charges), {@spell erupting earth|XGE} (3 charges) {@spell fireball} (3 charges), {@spell pulse wave|EGW} (3 charges) {@spell tidal wave|XGE} (3 charges), {@spell prismatic spray} (7 charges), {@spell prismatic wall} (9 charges)

entries.name: Master of Chaos
entries: As a reaction, whenever you make an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw, you can make that roll with advantage. You can choose to do so before or after you make the roll, potentially changing the result. In addition, you can cast plane shift at will, but you can only go to the elemental planes or the elemental chaos.

entries.name: Chaotic Burst
entries: While attuned to all of the items listed in, you may use an action to destroy the scepter and all of the other artifacts connected with this one. When you do so, you and every creature within 120 feet of you takes 10d6 acid, 10d6 cold, 10d6 fire, 10d6 lightning, 10d6 thunder, 10d6 poison, and 10d6 force damage. Every artifact destroyed in this way remains destroyed for 1d6 x 100 years, after which the artifacts reform themselves. Even a wish cannot alter the rate of which it reforms, nor can it reform the artifacts.

entries.name: Part of a Whole and Destroying the Set
entries: The Scepter of Chaos, {@item Amulet of The Bottomless Seas|ErikkusElementalExpansionCompendium}, {@item Belt of The Ancient Lands|ErikkusElementalExpansionCompendium}, {@item Cloak of The Boundless Skies|ErikkusElementalExpansionCompendium}, and the {@item Crown of Eternal Flames|ErikkusElementalExpansionCompendium} are all pieces of one artifact. However, only the Scepter of Chaos can connect them. While attuned to the scepter, you can attune to the other pieces of the whole and it doesn’t count toward your total number of used attunement slots.

When you are attuned to all of the listed items above, you have resistance to all damage. Each of the items cannot be destroyed by any means, unless the scepter is united with all of the artifacts and the creature attuned to the scepter uses its action to destroy all of the artifacts.

itemGroup.name: Robe of Elemental Defense
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to AC and saving throws while you wear these robes. You have resistance to one type of damage while you wear these elemental robes. The DM chooses the type or determines it randomly from the options below.
In addition, while not wearing armor you are always under the effects of the {@spell mage armor} spell.
items: Robe of Acidic Defense|ErikkusElementalExpansionCompendium
Robe of Icy Defense|ErikkusElementalExpansionCompendium
Robe of Fiery Defense|ErikkusElementalExpansionCompendium
Robe of Shocking Defense|ErikkusElementalExpansionCompendium
Robe of Toxic Defense|ErikkusElementalExpansionCompendium
Robe of Thunderous Defense|ErikkusElementalExpansionCompendium

entries: You have a {=bonusWeapon} bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. In addition, the sword can store up to 3 charges. Any time you take acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, or thunder damage the sword gains a charge. The sword loses any unused charges on the next dawn.

For every charge the sword has, it deals an additional d6 of damage. You determine the type of damage based on the number rolled on one of the d6s, you choose each time you deal damage with the sword. The table below determines the damage type.
